subject: Law
title: The Americans with Disabilities Act
description: A quick win: understand The Americans with Disabilities Act.

hook.text: Before 1990, a restaurant could refuse to serve someone in a wheelchair. The ADA made that illegal.

buildup.text: The ADA bans disability discrimination in employment, public services, and commercial facilities.

discovery.text: It defines disability broadly: a physical or mental impairment that substantially limits a major life activity.

twist.text: The ADA requires 'reasonable accommodation'â€”but not if it causes an employer 'undue hardship.' That line is blurry.

climax.text: The ADA Amendments Act (2008) expanded coverage after courts had narrowed disability definitions too much.

punchline.text: Disability rights mean removing barriers. The ADA made that a legal duty.

quiz.question: What does the ADA require from employers regarding disabled employees?
options: Reasonable accommodation unless it causes undue hardship
Full salary regardless of ability to work
